intro: Guatteria sordida var. ovalis, commonly known as the oval-leaf guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found growing in the understory of dense rainforests, where it thrives in shaded, moist environments. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that may be dispersed by birds and other wildlife.
